intro: Hieracium conspurcans subsp. eueimon, commonly known as the European meadow hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. It is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a common weed in agricultural and natural habitats.
